	LAND ROVER 2%
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	VOLVO 2%
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	OTHERS 2%
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv&#146;s vision of Saving More Lives is the guiding principle to more than 70,000
	associates in 27 countries. Each year, our products save over 30,000 lives and prevent ten times as many severe injuries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Who we are What we do
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For over six decades, Autoliv has demonstrated the ability to be responsive in real life safety situations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We are a Fortune 500 company and the world&#146;s largest automotive safety supplier with sales to all the leading car manufacturers in the
	world. We develop, manufacture and market protective systems such as airbags, seatbelts, steering wheels, passive safety electronics and active safety systems including brake control systems, radar, night vision and camera vision systems. We also
	produce pedestrian protection systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Human errors cause more than 90% of all fatal crashes, and the introduction of active safety
	systems is expected to increase road safety further, either by avoiding or reducing the speed of impact.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv&#146;s mission is to be
	the leading supplier of safety systems for the future car, well integrated with autonomous driving.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our values One Autoliv, Transparent,
	Innovative and Agile are a reflection of our company&#146;s DNA, as well as how we will succeed going forward. Not only do we strive to prevent serious accidents and injuries, we challenge ourselves to continuously focus on what is important &#150;
	consistency and quality for our customers, confidence and security for our employees, stability and growth for our shareholders, as well as being sustainable and earning trust within our communities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	HEADQUARTERS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Stockholm, Sweden
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	INCORPORATED
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Delaware, United States
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	SEGMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Passive Safety and Electronics
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ASSOCIATES &gt; 70,000 worldwide
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	OPERATIONS IN 27 countries
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	TECH CENTER LOCATIONS 22 worldwide
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	CRASH TEST TRACKS 19
	worldwide
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	LIVES SAVED &gt; 30,000 per year
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	PREVENT/REDUCE
	SEVERE INJURIES &gt; 300,000 annually
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2016 in Summary
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Solid growth and execution. Autoliv made significant investments for the future and executed on its M&amp;A strategy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16% organic growth in active safety
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	1)
</SUP>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$203m in direct shareholder returns
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	39% market share in the
	global passive safety market
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$868m in operational cash flow
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10% total sales growth
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$499m of CAPEX, supporting growth
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1) Non-US&nbsp;GAAP measure see page&nbsp;41 in the Annual Report for reconciliation
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Strong Organic Sales Growth
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016,
	consolidated sales were $10,074 million. Excluding negative currency translation effects and positive M&amp;A effects from our recent acquisition, Autoliv grew 7% organically, making it the seventh consecutive year with organic sales growth.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Dear Shareholder,
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	2016 was a year of solid execution and growth for Autoliv. It was also a year of high order intake and correspondingly high investments in the
	future growth of our company. The year was further characterized by significant changes in our industry, in both passive safety and electronics.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For the first time, Autoliv&#146;s sales in 2016 exceeded 10 billion dollars, resulting in a total sales growth of around 10%, double the
	growth of the global light vehicle production. Organic sales grew by over 7%. The additional sales growth was a result of recent M&amp;A and joint venture activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The double digit total sales growth shows that we are executing on our strategy of growing organically, through the solid execution of our
	on-going business and through the integration of assets coming from M&amp;A activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	It was also a year of continued high investments
	in preparation of strong anticipated future growth in both our business segments, Passive Safety and Electronics. These investments limit our short term earnings potential, but they will enable us to further strengthen our market leadership and
	earnings potential in the years to come.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The combination of growth and high investments resulted in an operating margin well within our
	long term target range of 8-9%. I am pleased that we were able to achieve this level of earnings while simultaneously making significant investments for the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investments for growth
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our expectations
	for high future growth are based on the high order intake we have experienced in 2015 and 2016. As indicated in our guidance for 2017 this &#147;high order intake &#150; high investment&#148; scenario that started already in 2015 and continued
	throughout 2016 will also impact 2017. This period of high investments, particularly in research, development and engineering, has two main purposes: to prepare us for the anticipated high future delivery volumes in passive safety and to invest
	further in product development in active safety to secure continued technology leadership. Both are necessary for our future growth and earnings potential.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Firstly, in our Passive Safety segment we have had two full years of around 50% order intake, more than 10% higher than our current passive
	safety market share. This positive development is leading to high investments, in preparation for our customers start of production. For example, in just two years, we have more than doubled the number of customer development projects. These
	projects will only start to generate revenues for us when our customers start production, which occur one and a half to three years after they are initiated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Secondly, within our Electronics segment we continued our high level of investment, mainly for product development in our active safety
	business. We fully believe in this strategy as active safety leading towards autonomous driving is one of the fastest growing business opportunities in the world. In this high growth area, we captured around 25% of the available business in 2016,
	which shows our customers&#146; confidence in our Active Safety products and Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Quality first
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our vision of Saving More Lives and our three core strategies: Quality, One Product one Process and Innovation remain unchanged. As always
	Quality is our main focus. In 2016 we continued to make progress in terms of our quality metrics. One key metric, developed to further sharpen our quality efforts is measuring &#147;zero defects&#148;. A zero defect requires a production line to run
	absolutely flawlessly. This is a very tough metric that only a few years ago seemed more like a distant aspiration than a target. Today more than 10% of our production lines run with zero defects for at least 15 consecutive days, more than double
	the proportion of lines only one year ago.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Despite our relentless focus on quality, we experienced some quality related issues in 2016.
	Although relatively limited, these can never be tolerated and we are taking additional measures to further strengthen certain aspects of our quality initiatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Strategic M&amp;A and joint ventures
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In
	addition to our investments for future growth and the continued sharp focus on quality, we executed strategically important M&amp;A and joint venture activities during the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At the end of the first quarter we finalized the agreement to form a joint venture in the area of brake control with the Japanese manufacturer
	Nissin Kogyo. The new company, Autoliv-Nissin Brake Systems (ANBS) is now operational. In the latter part of 2016 it recorded a significant new business win with a lifetime contract value of more than 1 billion dollars with a U.S. based car
	manufacturer.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In September we announced another strategic joint venture, this time with Volvo Car Corporation. This new company,
	subsequently named Zenuity, will represent a very important addition to our active safety strategy towards autonomous driving. The set-up is unique. All decision making and system level software development at Volvo Cars and Autoliv for Advanced
	Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Highly Autonomous Driving (HAD) will be concentrated in this joint venture. No other car manufacturer and tier one supplier have formed this type of 50/50 joint venture in such a strategic area. In addition
	Autoliv will market and sell Zenuity&#146;s software solutions to all car manufacturers globally. We strongly believe it will be a significant competitive advantage over the years to come as openness and collaboration become increasingly important
	for sharing the burden of high development costs and improving time to market in the area of autonomous driving. Zenuity is planning its start of operations for the first half of 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	This initiative fits perfectly with Autoliv&#146;s stated mission of being the leading safety system supplier for the future car, well
	integrated with autonomous driving.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Focus on sustainability
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During 2016 we have put increased focus on developing our sustainability strategy. We make contributions to society by staying at the forefront
	of technology, innovating and manufacturing high quality products that help our customers save more lives in real-life traffic. In 2017, we will also put more focus on developing targets to limit our impact on the environment, while continuing our
	on-going work to ensure ethical operations and being an employer of choice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Shareholder returns
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016, the S&amp;P 500 Index increased by about 10%, and the OMX All Shares Index in Stockholm where Autoliv&#146;s SDR&#146;s are listed,
	increased by 6%. The Autoliv share was down 9% on NYSE, while the OMX listed SDR&#146;s closed down 4% compared to one year ago. In 2016 relevant automotive indexes (S&amp;P and OMX) also underperformed the general market. Looking at the share over
	a three year period (a relevant cycle given Autoliv&#146;s typical time from order to revenues) Autoliv&#146;s share has outperformed the OMX All Share index by close to 50%, and also outperformed the S&amp;P 500 index.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the year Autoliv returned more than 200&nbsp;million dollars, or 2.30 dollars per share, to its shareholders through regular dividends,
	a new record.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We exited the year with a net debt to EBITDA ratio of 0.4x. It is our target that over time, this
	ratio should be between 0.5x and 1.5x. We are continuing to monitor this measure, as we aim to be shareholder friendly and over time return excess cash to our shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Looking ahead
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The automotive safety
	industry is in a period of great change. In Passive Safety one of our key competitors has encountered serious quality related issues and may be undergoing some form of restructuring. Meanwhile other main competitors have recently changed ownership.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In Electronics, particularly within active safety, rapid industry growth is expected to continue for many years and a group of companies
	both from the automotive and technology industries are positioning themselves to take part in this high growth environment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In this
	transitionary environment we continue to work toward our end of decade targets outlined at our Capital Markets day in 2015. Over time it is inevitable that some changes will occur as the market continues to develop and change. Currently, we believe
	we will surpass our corporate sales target of 12 billion dollars by the end of the decade while our target of achieving more than one billion dollars in active safety sales is likely to be realized one year later than originally anticipated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	For 2017 Autoliv anticipates full-year organic growth of around 4%. The expectation for the full year adjusted operating margin is around
	8.5%, excluding costs for capacity alignment and antitrust related matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	In summary
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv exists to save lives and create long term sustainable value for our stakeholders, particularly you the shareholder. To do this I
	believe we need to deliver in three areas.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	User experience, ensuring our products are easy to understand and use.
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We&nbsp;deal&nbsp;with&nbsp;the physical transportation of humans at very high speeds, which, should something go wrong, is a&nbsp;matter of
	life and death. If we deliver quality, robustness and a great user experience, we will create the trust needed to emerge as a winner in a transformed automotive industry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	With our vision of saving more lives and quality first as guiding lights we continue our journey to further strengthen our leadership in
	automotive safety.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Yours sincerely,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Jan Carlson
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Chairman, President&nbsp;&amp; CEO
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Stockholm, February&nbsp;23,
	2017
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Autoliv runs its business through two business segments: Passive Safety and Electronics.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Passive Safety
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Passive Safety is
	Autoliv&#146;s largest segment, and it includes Autoliv&#146;s airbag, steering wheel and seatbelt businesses, accounting for 79% of Autoliv&#146;s business in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The segment is organized in geographies: Europe, North America, South America, China, Korea, Japan&nbsp;&amp; South East Asia and India. The
	segment has full responsibility for profit and loss account, technology development, applications engineering and purchasing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2016 development
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Consolidated segment sales grew by close to 4% to $7,919 million compared to $7,621 million in the full year 2015. Excluding negative
	currency translation effects of more than $161 million, the organic sales growth was 6%. The organic sales growth was mainly due to higher sales in Europe, China, Japan, North America and India.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The improvement in operating margin is primarily because costs relating to antitrust matters and capacity alignments (particularly European)
	were higher in 2015 than in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Sales of
<B>
	airbag products
</B>
	(including steering wheels) were favorably impacted by higher sales of
	inflatable curtains in Japan and Europe, and steering wheels, especially in Europe.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Sales of
<B>
	seatbelt products
</B>
	were particularly
	strong in Europe and China. The global trend towards more advanced and higher value-added seatbelt systems continued globally.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Headcount
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in Passive Safety headcount was driven by growth in both sales and order intake, although at a lower rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	MIKAEL BRATT
</B>
	President Passive Safety
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Looking back
	at 2016, what are you most proud of?
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The ability to deliver quality and set the foundation for the unprecedented wave of new launches
	to be executed over the next few years. We have supported the industry need for replacement inflators, and see expansions of machine build, streamlining of processes and positive execution on existing contracts. It has been an exciting and eventful
	first year at Autoliv.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	What are you looking forward to in 2017?
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Execution on quality, delivery, and cost is the mantra for 2017. Quality is always at the forefront of all we do, and I look forward to
	continuing to embrace the zero defects culture in all dimensions of Q5. Our team is empowered as a stronger more autonomous segment to focus on our business situations and excel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Electronics
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Electronics integrates
	resources and expertise in passive safety electronics, active safety products and brake control systems into one organization. The segment has full responsibility for profit and loss account, technology development, applications engineering and
	purchasing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2016 Development
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Consolidated sales increased by close to 40% compared to the full year 2015. Excluding acquisition effects from ANBS and MACOM of $426 million
	and negative currency translation effects of more than $11 million, the organic sales growth was more than 13%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The lower operating
	margin was mainly a result of costs related to the formation of ANBS and higher costs for R,D&amp;E, net, partially offset by higher organic sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Growth in organic sales for
<B>
	passive safety electronics
</B>
	products (mainly airbag control modules and remote sensing units) was due to
	growth across most regions, particularly in China.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The strong increase in sales of
<B>
	active safety products
</B>
	(automotive radars,
	night vision systems, cameras with driver assist systems and positioning systems) resulted from growth particularly for radar products in North America and camera and radar products in Europe.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Sales of
<B>
	brake control systems
</B>
	were in line with our expectations from the start of operations of ANBS in the beginning of the second
	quarter of 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Headcount
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	increase in Electronics headcount was mainly due to the integration of ANBS and hiring of R,D&amp;E engineers in support of future growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	JOHAN
	L&Ouml;FVENHOLM
</B>
	President Electronics
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Looking back at 2016, what are you most proud of?
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A successful launch of state-of-the-art active safety products for Daimler, a well-managed sales growth in passive safety electronics, and the
	integration of a completely new family member in brake systems are excellent examples of great accomplishments that make my team and me proud. Securing new business in all product areas shows that we are on the right path toward our long-term growth
	targets.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	What are you looking forward to in 2017?
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A continued focus on growth without compromising operational excellence. This includes the challenge of taking on the big wave of engineering
	work that is following successful business wins. With a winning mindset, I am confident that my team will succeed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Industry Pioneer in Real Life
	Safety
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We are an industry pioneer in automotive real life safety with more than 60 years of innovation, from mechanical seatbelts in
	the 1950s to our current state-of-the-art active safety electronics and systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Traffic Safety Research
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our road to saving more lives starts with our relentless innovation in vehicle safety technologies in combination with a deep understanding of
	traffic situations, human behavior and human-to-machine interaction. In order to better understand real life accidents as well as new risks associated with higher level automated driving, we research and study accident data in combination with our
	own field operational tests. The way we innovate to develop and engineer solutions is a key differentiator that we believe will continue to set us apart from our competitors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Passive Technologies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Passive Technology
	for protection, from seatbelts and airbags to passive electronics, is our heritage and the foundation for Autoliv&#146;s strong position in real life vehicle safety. We have pioneered innovation in passive safety since the 1950s and incrementally
	innovate our passive portfolio to improve protection, such as active seatbelts and complementary airbag solutions. We continue to drive passive safety innovation for autonomous vehicles.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Active Technologies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Active Technologies
	for the prevention and prediction of accidents are key enablers of Real Life Safety. No single technology &#150; radar, vision, infrared, lidar or ultrasonic &#150; is able to cover all sensing requirements. Leveraging our strong base in radar and
	vision technologies, we continuously expand our know-how by adding new building blocks, such as braking and GPS features, toward autonomous driving.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	System integration
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Fully mastering the
	sequence of traffic events, from prevention to prediction to protection, with the aim of bringing the driver back to normal driving state before an accident occurs, requires sensor fusion based on complex software algorithms integrated with precise
	actuation and advanced passive safety features. This increased responsibility for managing the entire safety chain toward autonomous driving is something we can now offer to our customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	RADAR
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Avoid Blind Spot Crashes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A radar system detects and warns of objects in the vehicle&#146;s blind spots.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	RADAR
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Warn of Potential Collisions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	A radar system provides an all-weather object detection and an advance warning of potential collisions, up to 120 meters ahead. Long-range
	radars are used for Adaptive Cruise Control systems (ACC) and Autonomous Emergency Braking (AEB).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	CAMERAS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	An Extra Pair of Eyes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Mono and stereo
	vision cameras can recognize vehicles, pedestrians, speed signs and lane markings, and are used in the Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) to avoid collisions.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Seatbelts Prevent Fatalities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The combination of seatbelt, seatbelt pretensioners, load limiters, lap pretensioners and frontal airbags reduces the risk of life-threatening
	head or chest injuries in frontal crashes by 75%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Airbags
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In frontal crashes, driver airbags reduce fatalities by approximately 25% and reduce serious head injuries by over 60%. For front-seat
	passengers, fatalities are reduced by approximately 20%. Side-curtain airbags reduce the risk of life-threatening head injuries in side impacts by approximately 50% for passengers sitting on the side of the vehicle that is struck. Side airbags, rear
	side airbags, knee airbags and far-side airbags also help save lives and reduce serious injuries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	RADAR
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Queue Assist
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A radar controls stop-and-go functions in
	the queue.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	BRAKE CONTROL
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Optimum braking
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Brake Actuation and Brake Control use sensors to apply the correct braking pressure for a given condition. They also offer electronic
	stability control, anti-locking brakes and traction control systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	ADAS ECU
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	A Supporting Brain
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The ADAS ECU
	&#145;brain&#146; monitors the surroundings and fuses data from cameras, radars and sensors to interpret the situation and trigger ADAS features like emergency braking or automatic lane change. Satellite sensors &#150; in the door beam, in the
	pillar between the doors, the rocker panel, and/or at the front of the vehicle &#150; trigger seatbelt pretensioners and airbag systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NIGHT VISION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Night Driving Assist
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In
	challenging lighting &#150; at night, in fog, blinding headlight and sunlight glare &#150; collisions can be avoided as far infrared technology shows a heat-generated image of animals, pedestrians and more.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Steering wheels alert
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An integrated electrical motor can
	vibrate the steering wheel, alerting the driver to dangerous situations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	PEDESTRIAN PROTECTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Protect Pedestrians
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Thanks to a
	pyrotechnic hood-lifter and/or an outside pedestrian protection airbag, a pedestrian who is hit can avoid head injury caused by the hard area between the hood and the windscreen or one of the windshield pillars.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv&#146;s long-term targets reflect the key performance measures through which we execute
	our key strategies. The targets cover the areas of sales growth, capital structure, sustainable margins and earnings growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Financial Targets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Organic Sales
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Grow at least in line with our
	market. Definition on page 41 in the Annual Report. (Non-U.S. GAAP measure).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016, Autoliv&#146;s organic sales increased by 7%,
	compared to our underlying automotive safety market that grew by 8%. Sales growth was particularly strong in China and Europe, which grew by 14% and 10%, respectively, partly due to electronics.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Operating Margin
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8&#150;9% over the business cycles.
	(Non-U.S. GAAP excluding antitrust matters).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv achieved an adjusted operating margin, of 8.5% in 2016, within our long-term target
	range. This was achieved despite higher R,D&amp;E, net, and other costs related to investments for capacity and growth as well as acquisition effects.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Earnings Per Share
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Growth adjusted EPS faster than
	organic sales growth. (Non-U.S. GAAP excluding antitrust matters).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016, adjusted EPS (excluding antitrust related costs) grew by 11%,
	which was approximately 4 percentage points better than the organic sales increase. The operating profit and the number of outstanding shares were higher than prior year. The increase in EPS was mainly driven by lower costs for capacity alignment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Leverage Ratio
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Around 1 time within the range of
	0.5 to 1.5 times. Definition on page 87 in the Annual Report. (Non-U.S. GAAP measure).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our target ratio is around one time, within a
	range of 0.5 to 1.5 times. By the end of 2016, Autoliv had net debt of $313 million. The leverage ratio was 0.4. There were no share repurchases made during 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our Strategies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In addition to our vision
	of Saving More Lives, Autoliv&#146;s purpose is to create value for our main stake-holders: owners and creditors, customers, business partners, employees as well as family and society.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Quality
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Zero defects by flawless execution
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	One Product
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	One Process
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To improve cost effectiveness and robustness
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Innovation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To create unique selling points
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Quality
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Paramount in Saving More Lives
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Proactive Cycle
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Lessons Learned /Standards /Global Yokoten(s)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Proactive
	Poka-Yoke Before Issue Occurs
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Proactive Read-Across
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Active Follow Up
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Efficient Management of Risk, Resources,
	Timing&nbsp;&amp; Financials
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Quality always comes first. People&#146;s lives depend on our safety products. We strive for zero defects
	and quality must always come first.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Quality is a top priority for Autoliv, but the Company does not maintain it through programs or by
	performing close inspections alone. It is very much about the quality mindset in the Autoliv culture and the people who make up the organization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our quality mindset drives a constant focus on delivering quality products, which motivates us to improve our processes and provide on-time
	delivery of quality products to our customers. This quality mindset also achieves greater cost effectiveness to satisfy our stakeholders. But more importantly, we are providing best-in-class safety systems and saving more lives,&#148; says Svante
	Mogefors, Group VP Quality and Manufacturing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv implements its quality strategy through the Q5 program, which shapes a proactive
	quality culture of zero defects. It is called Q5 because it addresses quality in five dimensions: customers, products, suppliers, growth and behavior.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;Thanks to our relentless focus on quality in all dimensions, we have successfully reduced the number of nonconforming events since 2011
	by 49% despite the challenge of much higher sales volumes,&#148; Svante Mogefors says.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The goal is to tie quality firmly together with
	value in all our processes and for all our employees, thereby leading to the best value for all our customers. &#147;By developing the right skills and abilities of our people and continuously fostering a quality mindset &#150; we create a proactive
	culture and behavior that promotes goal alignment,&#148; says Svante Mogefors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	At the root of deeper engagement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	At Autoliv we know that if we increase output we need to increase the input in people. We apply a long-term strategy on quality practices and
	promoting the meaning of our work. We have purpose alignment &#150; saving more lives &#150; we care about what we do and this makes for deep, not shallow, engagement. And we have role alignment, which means we challenge people to crowd source ideas
	for improvements and we celebrate the good and the bad findings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#145;We&#146;re doing this because we want to save more lives,&#148;
	Mogefors asserts. &#147;That&#146;s the common thread that runs all the way down from the top of the company to the shop floors.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv has promoted this mindset through programs such as its &#147;Zero Defect&#148; initiative. &#147;Rather than thinking about PPMs or
	defects per million, we hold ourselves to a standard of zero defects delivered through operations to our customers,&#148; he explains. This is marked in days and is celebrated each time it reaches 15 consecutive days, thereby making it accountable,
	obtainable and measured.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In 2016, Autoliv extended its zero defects roll-out to suppliers and non-production, applying its methodology
	and learnings globally, resulting in a significant increase in lines achieving zero defects.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	When quality deviations do occur, they rarely affect the protection provided by our products.
	Most deviations are due to other requirements, such as flawless labeling, precise delivery of the right parts at the right moment, color and texture nuance on steering wheels and other products where the look and feel is important to the car buyer.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Zero Defect culture
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;We take a
	workshop approach with the production team responsible for each production line, to align the team&#146;s focus on identifying the obstacles to zero defects and overcoming those obstacles.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Surprisingly, this approach does not typically result in the need for large capital investment or the implementation of sophisticated new
	tools in production lines during this process. &#147;It&#146;s more about the behavior of the people who know the product best,&#148; Mogefors says. &#147;They know what physical barriers are involved in the production line on a daily basis. They
	are empowered to share their insights and ideas to address the root causes of defects once they are understood. And they are celebrated both for finding an error which can be addressed, and for hitting target days with no errors.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;We aspire to the day when all our production lines produce zero defects on a daily basis,&#148; he says, noting that this has required
	some retraining of employees to the zero defect mindset. &#147;It&#146;s really more about training in the concept and exposure to how applying a different way of thinking to our daily activities can be effective.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv has seen strong results from the Zero Defects initiative. &#147;We have many examples of production lines delivering zero defects in
	electronics, seatbelts and airbags,&#148; he says.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;We are all united in the common vision of saving more lives. It is at the heart
	of everything we do and it means our operators don&#146;t just sew airbags, but save lives. And it aligns our common goals across the globe.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#147;You never stop improving if you identify things that can be improved,&#148; Mogefors says.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Jidoka is Me
</B>
	&#150; Automation with a human touch
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Operator Anna was working on a seatbelt line when she noticed that a rail she was holding felt slightly lighter than normal. She stopped the
	line and initiated her team to check the rail dimensions. They detected that the part dimensions were different than the specs. The normal finished part weight is 292 grams and this finished part was 261 grams. A root cause analysis by the supplier
	showed the part had not been coated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Traceability, stringent supplier quality and robust audits are part of Autoliv&#146;s approach to
	flawless execution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Autoliv&#146;s strategy One Product One Process (1P1P)&nbsp;drives reduction of cost and complexity. Through
	effective standardization and by the application of lessons learned, we increase robustness and prevent incidents, creating increased customer satisfaction and value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Day-to-day 1P1P is being executed with a global mindset in the areas of product design, manufacturing process, supplier management and
	knowledge transfer within Autoliv and to its partners. &#147;With 1P1P, we drive standardization and cost reduction in our core products and customer features, without sacrificing the need for customer variations in product design,&#148; says Mikael
	Bratt, President Passive Safety, Autoliv.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Global teams
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Global cross-functional teams with the authority and responsibility to manage one or several product families drive the standardization
	process. During 2016, over 90% of Autoliv&#146;s products were covered by 1P1P teams. &#147;This ensures that best practices, lessons learned and other product-related knowledge are properly and efficiently collected, transferred and applied into
	production of existing products as well as for new customer developments,&#148; says Mikael Bratt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With 1P1P, we drive standardization and cost reduction
	in our core products and customer features, without sacrificing the need for customer variations in product designs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Mikael Bratt President Passive
	Safety, Autoliv
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	One Product One Process
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Improving
	cost effectiveness and robustness
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Cost efficiency targets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The 1P1P strategy supports Autoliv&#146;s annual cost efficiency targets:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Consolidate the supply base to 1,000 supplier groups by 2016 through global sourcing to optimize cost without
	compromising service and knowledge.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Reduce direct material costs by at least 3%.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
